name: 1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
Reference Documents: IFC Project Drawings/ Drawing Register
Record of conformity: Latest revision IFC drawings, ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents: OHSMP, EMP, TMS,  SWMS, WP
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Frequency: Prior to works commencing 1 per delivery
Acceptance Criteria: Reinforcing supply quantities in accordance with the drawings and AS/NZS 4671.
Record of conformity: Receival inspection checklist
Frequency: Prior to works commencing 1 per delivery

Acceptance Criteria: Cast-In items to be in accordance with the drawings and manufacturer specifications. All surface exposed, cast-in components are to be hot dip galvanised and fire protected as required.
Record of conformity: Receival inspection checklist
Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall be at minimum 28-day strength, F’c of 32 MPa and when placed shall be well rammed to ensure thorough consolidation. Concrete slump shall be 100mm +/- 20mm
Reference Documents: EW-ST-DRW-10- 0005 Table 5.1 of AS1379
Acceptance Criteria: Provide 24 hr inspection notice for Superintendent confirmation of footings location.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Excavation to be to the depth and size required for the concrete footing.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Min. 200mm of concrete blinding layer below the base of the pad footing.

○ Where a footing does not extend to the level required within the acceptable founding material, the contractor is to provide a weak-mix blinding concrete (minimum N15) for the footprint of the footing to achieve the required depth
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Formwork shall conform to shapes, lines, levels and dimensions of the concrete shown or indicated on the Drawings.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Reinforcement type and design to be in accordance with DWG EW-ST-DRW-10-0020.
○ Reinforcing steel shall be bent and placed in accordance with AS 4671 and sufficient bar chairs shall be installed to ensure reinforcement is in the correct position.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
– Position and spacing check and recorded
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Installation of cast in items as per manufacturer specifications
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall not be placed until:
(i) the evidence that the forms, reinforcement, any stressing materials and embedments conforming to the requirements of the specification and the drawings, has been reviewed by the Superintendent
(ii) all foreign material has been completely removed from the forms
– Superintendent requires 48 HR notice for inspection.
Record of conformity: Pre Pour Inspection Checklist Completed
Acceptance Criteria: Footings shall be constructed in accordance with the detail shown on the drawings.
Record of conformity: Concrete pour record and delivery docket

Acceptance Criteria: Concrete to be vibrated to ensure compaction and air voids removed. Screed finish required on exposed surfaces. Concrete surface finishes to meet Class 4 requirements as per table 3.2.3 and 3.3.5.1 of AS 3610. (Attached Below)
Record of conformity: Completion of prepour inspection checklist

Acceptance Criteria: Testing for conventionally reinforced elements: UNO in specifications or on drawings, the contractor is to arrange for project sampling for every 50m³ of concrete supplied (1000m³ in the case of shrinkage tests alone).
○ Provide slump, 7- and 28-day compressive strength and shrinkage test results in accordance with AS 1379 and AS 1012.1 to the engineer, as a minimum.
○ Concrete Testing to be carried out as per specifications in AS 1379
Acceptance Criteria: Concrete to be cured as per project specifications.

○ All concrete elements are to be actively cured for a minimum of 14 days following pouring by ponding or an approved proprietary system. The contractor shall submit the proposed curing methodology to the engineer for approval prior to pouring.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Stripping of vertical faces in accordance with C.1.8.13 of EW-ST-SPC-000001.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Surface Tolerances to be in accordance with Table 3.3.5.1 of AS 3610 As-built survey completed for lot
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Completion of Pre Pour checklist quality checks.
Record of conformity: Pre Pour Inspection Checklist Completed
Acceptance Criteria: Backfilling to match pavement design and to occur min. 72 hours post concrete pour.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
